channel.title: Motherboard help :D
channel.description:
Okay so my friend brought his pc to me with a processor he wants me to put in it, I have all the things to do it but I need to know if this processor is compatible with the Motherboard :The one in his pc now is a: "Intel Pentium 4 641" The one he brought me is a "Intel Pentium D" His chipset is a i945g "ECS Livemore" The Pentium D is also a i945g. Will his pc still work after i put the new processor in it? [url=http://prntscr.com/6rtm42]http://prntscr.com/6rtm42[/url]
:Edit: This is the intel Pentium D supported sockets "Sockets Supported PLGA775" This is the Intel Pentium 4 Supported sockets "Sockets Supported PLGA775"

item.title: Motherboard help :D
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:7, topic:550998”][quote author=Zymus link=topic=669914.msg4479639#msg4479639 date=1428705172]

Are you sure the new CPU supports the same RAM as the old one?

This is the only thing I can think of. Is it the processor, or the chipset that determines this?
[/quote]

Shouldn’t really, Chipset normally should determine everything, but varying FSB speeds etc may also affect compatibility.[/quote]

That’s something I missed :palm: I feel stupid now. Thank you for all your help

Read full topic

item.title: Motherboard help :D
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Zymus, post:5, topic:550998”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=669914.msg4479635#msg4479635 date=1428704311]
Are you sure the new CPU supports the same RAM as the old one?
[/quote]

This is the only thing I can think of. Is it the processor, or the chipset that determines this?[/quote]

Shouldn’t really, Chipset normally should determine everything, but varying FSB speeds etc may also affect compatibility.

Read full topic

item.title: Motherboard help :D
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Check system bus speeds for the RAM and the CPU.

Read full topic

item.title: Motherboard help :D
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“Zymus, post:2, topic:550998”][quote author=google link=topic=669914.msg4479476#msg4479476 date=1428623437]
Okay so my friend brought his pc to me with a processor he wants me to put in it, I have all the things to do it but I need to know if this processor is compatible with the Motherboard :The one in his pc now is a: “Intel Pentium 4 641” The one he brought me is a “Intel Pentium D” His chipset is a i945g “ECS Livemore” The Pentium D is also a i945g. Will his pc still work after i put the new processor in it? http://prntscr.com/6rtm42

:Edit: This is the intel Pentium D supported sockets "Sockets Supported PLGA775"
This is the Intel Pentium 4 Supported sockets “Sockets Supported PLGA775”

[/quote]

If the CPU has the same socket as the Motherboard, you’re fine.[/quote]

Thank you, Zymus.

:Edit: So after i got the new processor in The pc read it. But after the loading screen it’d Bsod. I even tried re-seating the CPU yet nothing worked I put the Pentium 4 back in it and it worked fine, What do i do?

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“RUNE-PK, post:1, topic:550998”]Okay so my friend brought his pc to me with a processor he wants me to put in it, I have all the things to do it but I need to know if this processor is compatible with the Motherboard :The one in his pc now is a: “Intel Pentium 4 641” The one he brought me is a “Intel Pentium D” His chipset is a i945g “ECS Livemore” The Pentium D is also a i945g. Will his pc still work after i put the new processor in it? http://prntscr.com/6rtm42

:Edit: This is the intel Pentium D supported sockets "Sockets Supported PLGA775"
This is the Intel Pentium 4 Supported sockets “Sockets Supported PLGA775”[/quote]

If the CPU has the same socket as the Motherboard, you’re fine.
